alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 6:05PM EST until February 05 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Etowah River near Dawsonville affecting Dawson and Forsyth Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Etowah River near Dawsonville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached and minor flooding begins in south Dawson county. Minor flooding continues on Nicholson Road in northwest Forsyth county. The water will be around one foot deep on the road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
